page.title: 04The Basingstoke Canal.
page.content: Part of the Basingstoke Canal runs through the village. It is approx 200 years old. It was 37 miles long and joins the River Wey at New Haw. At first it carried agricultural produce from Hampshire to London, particularly wheat, flour and timber. In return coal and manufactured goods were brought from London. Bricks were also carried for local buildings, in particular St. Mary's Church, The Victoria Hall and for the building of the Barracks in Aldershot. Wharf Road takes its name from the wharf on the canal, where there was a Boat yard. The canal fell into disuse after the 2nd World War and was bought by Surrey and Hampshire County Councils in the l960's. Since l980 it has been under active restoration. It is now 90% restored and is part of the leisure facilities of the area.
